page.title: 16Cropwell Bishop,The Cobbler
page.content:
In Cropwell Bishop we have a cobbler and a sweet shop all in one, but very recently the cobbler,{Tom Barrett,} owner of the sweet shop, very sadly died on the{7th of April, 1985.}He wanted to carry on with his work until he was{100 years old,}but only made it to{91.}He was buried on his {ninety-second birthday} June 13th in Cropwell Bishop Church's Cemetery. It is said that Tom Barrett died of a stroke. Mr. Barrett's shop was knocked down on the 4th of June as it is said that there is a well underneath it.Now they are planning to re- open it. There is now nothing left to remind us of him except memories and photographs.
Authors:{Katie Jane Hutchinson & {Alan Anthony Eastwood.
